Activity: Log in, check emails, and review yesterday's progress on bug reporting system. Check if there are any critical issues raised by the @Qtest-1 team.
Address any critical bugs or issues reported by the QA team or playtesters. Prioritize fixing issues that block progress or significantly impact the player experience.
Refactor the code base to improve its overall quality and maintainability. Address any code smells or technical debt that have accumulated over the week.
Optimize the game's performance. Profile the code to identify bottlenecks and optimize the areas that are consuming the most resources.
Write unit tests for the core modules. Ensure that the code is well-tested and that any changes do not introduce regressions.
Create a build of the game and distribute it to the QA team and playtesters for further testing and feedback.
Write a summary report of the week's progress. Highlight the key accomplishments, challenges faced, and lessons learned.
Plan for the next week's goals and tasks. Prioritize the most important tasks and create a detailed schedule for the week ahead.
Commit the changes to the version control system. Review and organize all notes and documentation from the week. Prepare for the weekend.
